page.title: 15LANDSCAPE
page.content: SOMERSHAM IS SITUATED ON THE EDGE OF THE FENS. TO THE NORTH-EAST LIES THE TYPICAL LOW, FLAT FEN COUNTRYSIDE GIVING THE OPPORTUNITY OF SEEING LARGE EXPANSES OF SKY WITH ITS VARIEID HUES AND CLOUD FORMATIONS. MUCH OF THE LAND IS COVERED WITH OPEN FIELDS DIVIDED BY THE ODD HEDGE BUT OFTEN BY DYKES DUG FOR DRAINAIGE. IN THE WINTER THE FIELDS SHOW UP AS DARK BROWN WHEN THE RICH PEAT SOIL HAS BEEN PLOUGHED. IN THE SUMMER THE FIELDS ARE GREEN WITH SUGAR BEET AND VEGETABLES, BRIGHT YELLOW WITH OIL SEED RAPE FLOWERS OR GOLDEN WITH RIPE WHEAT. A FEW TREES SHOW UP AGAINST THE HORIZON AND THE ODD BUILDING IS PROBABLY A FARM BUILDING OR COTTAGE. BETWEEN SOMERSHAM AND COLNE THE ORCHARDS LOOK THEIR BEST IN SPRING WHEN IN BLOSSOM, OVERLOOKED BY THE CHURCH TOWER WITH ITS SHORT SPIRE.
